Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2015 08:36PM DSW1976 wrote: Sorry you are in this position but this place will be your sanity.  When you are at you breaking point and no one around you understands read some posts it will comfort you to know they get it and you arent alone.  And if you have any questions too. Good luck. Like they said before 80% benign birad4 . Waiting is the hardest part. Diane
Posts.Title: Please Help While I am Waiting shaninaz Rachel0214

Posts.Content: Mar 17, 2015 09:59AM DSW1976 wrote: It is the worst waiting.  Im sorry you have to go through this and that it isnt your first time around.  Im hoping they will call you sooner.  Did they give you a birad score?
Posts.Title: Anxiously Waiting KZC13 DSW1976

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2015 09:24AM DSW1976 wrote: I went to gyno for abnormal vag bleeding by fluke he sent me for a mammo I laughed my way through it since I was a size A and had no clue you could have breast cancer without a lump .  I had no lump at all microcacifications that already escaped to my lymphnode very agressive .    My gyno saved my life.  They knew by the mammogram it was cancer qnd just needed biopsy to confirm.  I was a birad5 .  They know what they are dealing with before the biopsy.

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2015 08:55AM DSW1976 wrote: My heart goes out to you and you are not alone .  The ladies here go above and beyond to help.  Som e one has always been there done that or are currently in the same boat .   Waiting sucks and there is nothing you can do to escape the what ifs.  What I did was read posts to educate myself and honestly if I coulnt escape it why not throw myself at it and get  knowledge of what may lay ahead.   Hang in there and I pray your membership isnt a permanent one .
Posts.Title: Need of support alicki Laura_E

Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2015 03:12PM DSW1976 wrote: I would go in knowing it can and might change.  I went in stage 1 came out stage .2. No ones fault glad my surgeon suggested masectomy and they also found positive lymph node long breast mri missed day before. They can try to estimate things but they told me they werent 100% sure till after surgery path. Good luck

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2015 04:32PM DSW1976 wrote: alicki , You are so kind lending support as you are going through things as well.  Thats what this is all about listening and being kind and trying to help or sometimes just let people know you get it.   I just statred posting recently and got the impression Im over stepping my bounds being so new to CANCER .  Seriously its cancer not the type of thing you want and I well remeber being frantic looking for answers or any HELP I could cause you are so lost.  I wouldn't wish that feeling on anyone.  Thanks again for helping her and many more that will read this .

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2015 02:22PM DSW1976 wrote: ASpiePoet,   Just wanted to let you know you are in my thoughts and not alone.  Like they said above 80% of all lumps are benign so hang in there.  I know is so hard to do and hopefully they can give you some kind of an idea on the 3rd.  Make sure if they send you for a biopsy not saying they will but if they do based on mammogram ask for birad score.  Good luck

Posts.Title: Does this look like an IBC rash?? Mommy30 didi768

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2015 04:19PM - edited Mar 15, 2015 04:25PM by DSW1976 jarriss 77 ----Thank you so much for recognizing she needs a calming voice and someone to listen and thats what I was trying to do.  I felt bad for her , we all know what it is like to be in her shoes and I feel like sometimes they come here for help and get scalded for it.  I really dont think thats what this site intentions are or ever have been.  The how dare you think you have cancer attitude made me worried to post any question since september when I was diadnosed  I finally did because of wonderful ladies like you.  Its not a right of passage for od sakes its cancer that no one wants but are scared they may have it  .   Thank you again it hopefully will make her feel better about posting.

Posts.Title: MY symptoms and concerns while I wait JesusLVS JesusLVS

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2015 02:50PM DSW1976 wrote: I Didnt want.to give you miss information on the exact meanin of birad.  Score but for me it was given after my mammogram before biopsy for likely hood of cancer mine was birad 5 . I just had 2 other lumps that came up come up again after chemo and surgery at a 3 and my dr said not to worry so I am not. She said fat necrosis. There are many things it can be. I never had a lump with my original diagnosis so I don't know a cancerous one feels but a have a swollen lymph node in my cancer side arm pit. Sorry again but you have found the best place to be. These ladies will get you thru.

Posts.Title: Am i being paranoid? kat56310 Ariom

Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2015 02:08AM DSW1976 wrote: I have horrible hip,leg and lower back pain onc says chemo doesn't effect just one area, then I saw hip surgeon who told me the same thing.  I have yet to have a single test done so now I am goiung to demand it .  Im still on taxol & herceptin so I thought that was the cause but with both saying no Im worried.  Hope that helps and so sorry you all are in pain.  Bone pain is the worst. Diane
Posts.Title: Bone and joint pain Hope40 dunesleeper

Posts.Content: Jun 8, 2015 01:10AM DSW1976 wrote: MAmmos don't always detect breast cancer first off so thank god you got a ultra sound and finally a biopsy.  Did they give you a birad score? And second thats awful you found a second lump. I feel sorry for you and at risk of sounding like a broken record most are benign.  Call your Dr. tomarrow as it can happen in both. Best of luck.
Posts.Title: help! in shock don't know what to think plumster1 plumster1

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2015 12:38PM DSW1976 wrote: I talked to my sons GP then american cancer society .   Also only you know your child and what they can handle too much knowledge can be damaging at this age.  I told my son I had cancer and the Dr was gonna fix me and give me medicine and my hair was gonna fall out then at the time I let him buzz my hair as it was down to my waist and he loved it.  I dont share with him when I feel bad he doesnt need to know.   I put his feelings before anyones he is a child and as much as none of us deserve this our kids suffer the most.  We are there everything and when we are broken they know and feel it .  So sorry you are dealing with this and your husband and you need to get on the same page.
Posts.Title: Husband doesn't want to tell our 5 year old ChristaSea

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2015 12:41PM DSW1976 wrote: Sorry one more thing!  We also have our son in a courageous kids group through american cancer society where other kids are in the same situation and they talk about it and play and have fun.  Jury is still out on it with me due to the fact if someones parent dies it affects them to hear about it .   This all sucks.  Trust your gut.
Posts.Title: Husband doesn't want to tell our 5 year old ChristaSea

Posts.Content: Mar 14, 2015 01:20PM DSW1976 wrote: You will get through this one way or another and will be sitting here 6 months down the road trying to help someone newly diagnosed as I am .   I don't have the experience or knowledge of alot if these wonderful ladies but if anything I have been through can someone else I try .   You are in for one hell of a ride.  You will see that the little one is goung to be the light out of this dark tunnel on the worst of days and all others the ladies here.  My heart goes out to you and your family.  Don't be affraid to ask for help...
